page.title: 15TRANSPORT
page.content: This May Mr.Derrick Gilmour,the harbourmaster will leave his office on Shore Street for the new site down river by Longman Drive.He will have a fine view of the Firth and the harbour.The mudflats at the river mouth have been filled in and two more berths and a wide quay are being constructed.This extension was aided by E.E.C.money. Each year half a million tonnes of refined oil is imported and piped to storage tanks opposite Citadel Quay. Great piles of pulpwood are being loaded on barges to be towed out to a ship in Munlochy Bay,bound for Sweden. Alongside,mobile cranes are unloading a cargo of Scandinavian sawn timber for housebuilding.About 35 cargo vessels arrive each month,bringing mainly coal and road salt and exporting dry bulk grain.
